values:
some are talented
evocative images
blossom from the page
but the magic eludes me
my words remain simply words

Good news, I made it through the whole month
Bad news, I still dont have that spark.

wonderful warm sun
shorts and glorious bare feet
in late November
enjoy it as long as it 
last, snow is not far behind

predicted to fall in 36 hours...
The cat and I enjoyed the weather with a nice afternoon walk.

steaming comfort food
warm bed strong walls solid roof
furry purry friends
clean clothes good friends family
blessings come in many shapes

Thankful for all those and so many more things.

crunchy autumn leaves
sun reflecting on the snow
steaming hot cocoa
blanket and a favorite book
perfect way to spend a day

unpretentiously
she smiles gently on the world
bringing joy to all
though her time is shorter now
still she ventures brightly forth

I was tempted to write of the taiko rythms in my skull, but it seemed wrong, so that is the best the current migraine let me create.

stars wink overhead
moon a sliver in the west
wind rattles the trees
safe and snug tucked in my bed
so why am I not asleep

Yes, it should be about nature, but this is all that came today.  Tomorrow is a big day and I am STRESSING over it.  Silly since in 24 hours it will no longer matter :-)

fencing night again
got home much too late to post
but I ran the line
how I did it I don't know
really wish I had a clue

Day late, reason explained above...

I was just grumping to a friend that I was not going to be able to keep up the writing one a day because nothing was flowing today.. and this bit me.

waiting patiently
black and white and tawny fur
all eyes watching me
stop that tapping on the keys
we are starving, can't you see

All three boys were sitting in the kitchen next to their empty food bowl, HINT :-)
Thanks for the inspiration kids.

breathtakingly white
crystals sparkling everywhere
on the smooth cold shroud
trees bend 'neath their heavy load
will the suns warmth melt it soon

dancing on the wind
dressed in white like debutantes
at their coming out
but by morning all will need
to be shoveled off the walk

what a sight

each by side by each
black shapes sitting in a row
natures string of pearls
telephone wires today
where will you be tomorrow

and it went on for 3 or 4 poles worth, each wire (3 or 4 strands each) was bird by bird by bird.  All small and black in the dusky end of day.

This was written last night, but due to technical difficulties I was not able to post it till just now.

Fencing practice night
Kill your friends but don't hurt them
Get it right for WAR
Doesn't leave much time to write
Daily tanka challenge post.

I think Im in a rut... or maybe just typecast

silly kitty cat
first you nip and shy away
then you follow me
purr and snuggle and curl up
next to me as I sit here

Little purry friend
I am glad you want to play
with your furry schmouse
but midnight is not the time
for me to play fetch with you

Im actually surprised I have been able to keep this up, but it seems to get a little easier each day. Of course the right inspiration helps. Today was inspired by a certain longhaired baby kitty last night. And it was not only at midnight, but also at 1, and 2 and 3am (and yes I confiscated the schmousie each time, and he found another one each time...) Im sooo tired.

Edit: corrected a typo to 'purry' at 9:42

Sundar afternoon 
always ending much too soon
these two days of rest
Five more days of stress and toil
before weekend comes again.

Wow, that was NOT what was in my head, but apparently it was in my fingers.

It may be saturday, but that meant I could wake slowly and actually let the daily tanka perk.

Blessed morning brew
helps me face another day
if only I could
teach the cats to pour a cup
and then bring it to my bed

(I use the two-syllable version: bless-sed)

Beauty from the east
brilliant orange swirled with mauve
is her dancing dress
Slowly fades to peach and gray
but the memory remains

unexpectedly
rising up out of the dawn
just a wall of names
each a life ended too soon
sibling, lover, parent, friend.

The traveling wall memorial exhibit was out on the center lawn when I walked up this morning.  I did not know it was scheduled to stop here.  My words do not truly do it justice; there was no way to include CHILD without leaving out something else in the tanka format, and JUST a wall was meant to convey the simple, but deciving, nature of the display.  It is just a wall, but the impact is rather like a punch to the gut.  Talk about INSPIRATION!

second try.  I was spellchecking the first one and it ATE IT...

The tanka challenge was posted and this one bit me on the ankle (the only way I seem to be able to write anything)  I have no delusions of being able to create 30 tanka in 30 days, but I have ONE, so that is at least a start

Dandelion now

how the heck did you survive

two full feet of SNOW

that fell just three days ago

yet today seems but a dream

Yes, this really happened.  This morning, as I was taking my cat for his walk, there was one bright yellow impertinent dandilion blossom at the very edge of the lawn (the maybe 2" at the edge of the lawn where the sun had eaten the snow) The same lawn that Thursday was completely hidden under 23+ inches of snow.  And yes, by the end of today most of the lawn had been de-snowed, and what remained was no thicker than 3". 
Oh, and the first line is in honor of a friend who passed too soon, and is still missed.

Gakked from and others.  Not my usual but what do ya'll think?


You are The Empress


Beauty, happiness, pleasure, success, luxury, dissipation.


The Empress is associated with Venus, the feminine planet, so it represents,
beauty, charm, pleasure, luxury, and delight. You may be good at home
decorating, art or anything to do with making things beautiful.


The Empress is a creator, be it creation of life, of romance, of art or business. While the Magician is the primal spark, the idea made real, and the High Priestess is the one who gives the idea a form, the Empress is the womb where it gestates and grows till it is ready to be born. This is why her symbol is Venus, goddess of beautiful things as well as love. Even so, the Empress is more Demeter, goddess of abundance, then sensual Venus. She is the giver of Earthly gifts, yet at the same time, she can, in anger withhold, as Demeter did when her daughter, Persephone, was kidnapped. In fury and grief, she kept the Earth barren till her child was returned to her.

hmmmm, OK maybe it's time to listen...

Thursday, aka Xmas day
My turn to host.  I was a bit scattered, but overall I think it worked,  The smoked salmon bruscetta were missing the diced tomato (no one complained), but the bubbly was cold and sweet.  The goose was wonderfully crackly-skinned, and very tender, but for some reason the carving was a pain (the joints did NOT want to give - yes, it was cooked through, the meat pulled off the  bones.)  The red cabbage was moms work and delicious as always, the potatoes were mashed yukons and fine, the cucumber salad was good, I forgot to get a tin of pineapple and ran out of time, so the layered fruit salad didnt get made (not sure anyone missed it) and the gravy (made from the goose drippings and a half bottle of syrah got RAVE reviews.  
The furry kids mooched bites, and were generally snuggly, sweet and cute (Jack fell asleep on his back, belly exposed, back paws twitching in the air).  Amazingly, everything and everyone was peaceful!
Happiness is a good goose (grin) shared with family.

Wednesday
ok, so Im a bit behind.  Xmas eve, whats not to be happy about?  
I found ALL the gifts I could not find in all my shopping last week  in one fell swoop this afternoon on the way home from feeding a friends cats - WHOOT its nice when the good karma is right there.
Had a nice hour of poppyseed loaf, coffee, candles and carols with the parents, then ran home to wrap presents (Like I said, Im behind.. wrap at 5 to unwrap 3 hours later ;-)
Back to mom and dads for a cup of soup and a movie (mom got to open her present early - Mama-Mia) then baby bother finally got off work and showed up with both dogs (my niece and nephew - Dachshunds - he is 16.5 now, she has a grapefruit-sized tumor and was given 2 months to live back in August.)  so it was WONDERFUL to see both of them still wagging their tails and wanting loving.  We had the usual fantastic dinner, then opened presents and took photos of the dogs enjoying their treats and the new dogbed they got.
Happiness is 2 warm (elderly) puppies!

Tuesday
Happiness is BEING DONE!
I got out of work a little over 2 hours late, but IM DONE.  Contracts are good to go, website is updated, plants were all watered till they squished!  IM DONE.  I dont have to set foot in the office again till NEXT YEAR!

But the best part is, being home with purry snuggly kitties.

Sunday 
Happiness is baking with your mom!  
I had a lovely day today in mom's kitchen.  We had holiday tunes on to keep us in the right mood (and both sang along at times) while I blanched almonds and she sifted flour, I chopped almonds and she mixed butter and sugar , I opened tins of poppy seeds and she added eggs, we checked the dough, then took a break for lunch.  After lunch I rolled out dough while she mixed poppy seeds with eggs and almonds to make 'asphalt.'  Together we spread the filling on the dough then needed all four hands and 2 long towels to roll up the probably 40" long 'jelly roll' (really filled with poppy seeds not cream or jelly)  Finally we cut it into 4 lengths and gently lifted each into a prepared loaf pan.  close to 2 hours later we had 4 yummy cakes, sadly they need to sit at least 24 hours before they taste good (I took a tiny nibble hot from the oven, and it did not taste like I know it will by the 25th.) 
This is a recipe we traditionally make in December and ONLY ever make for xmas, and we have made it for as long as I can remember. 
Family traditions, another wonderful thing.

Gakked from  

The rules are that for eight days you have to post something that made you happy that day.

Day 1:

For me this was actually Saturday, the day I read it, but I didnt have time to post.

Happiness is: having friends to cook for and spend time with. I had 7 wonderful friends over for a celebration of the season on Saturday. We had songs, gifts, a lit tree, food (ok, more of a feast - I served a roast pork loin seasoned with garlic and rosemary, pickled crabapples (one of my younger guests very kindly emptied the entire jar of what was left after everyone had what they wanted (talk about making me feel good - they were home made and I thought a bit too tart and mushy, but he obviously approved :-) Also a whole roasted squash (hollowed out the seeds and filled with chunks of garlic and butter and black pepper), parsnip sticks oven baked with a bit of butter, same treatment for beets (if you have never had oven roasted beets - try them they are sweet and yummy), a head of garlic also oven roasted, a dish of macrows (medieval mac-n-cheese seasoned with black pepper and nutmeg - YUM) Oh and leeks simmered in a bit of butter (and more black pepper and a pinch of salt - that long simmer turned them silky and sweet. We also had appetizers of pickled herring, gravlax (sorry storebought this time,) cold shrimp, radishes, marinated mozzarella balls. Dessert was the amazing assortment of cookies everyone brought - the worlds best gingersnaps, wonderful sugarcookies, lintzer bars (yum) and more that I did not sample.
We toasted the end of the year, the start of the new, the season in general, and all friends (passed, present and yet to meet) with a bottle of homebrewed mead (Catsclaw honey about 10 years old and much better than I remembered.)

It was a wonderful evening, the warm glow of the candles matched the warm feeling of being with friends, the songs of the season and the warm food on the table. I am truly blessed!

Well that eliminates me from 'Twilight' doesn't it. (Nope have not read or seen, but seems to be the in thing at the moment.)  Meme gakked from

Would love to hear your thoughts on this:

Your result for Which Tarot Card Represents Your Higher Self? Test...

The High Priestess

-1 0Fool, -1 1Magician, 6 2Priestess, 2 3Empress, 0 4Emperor, 2 5Hierophant, -1 6Lovers, 2 7Chariot, 3 8Strength, 1 9Hermit, -1 10WheelOfFortune, 6 11Justice, 2 12HangedMan, -1 13Death, 3 14Temperance, -1 15Devil, 0 16Tower, 4 17Star, 5 18Moon, 2 19Sun, 0 20Judgement and 2 21World!


 

The High Priestess is arguably the most difficult of the Major Arcana to qualify with words alone, because so much of her power and ability is veiled in mystery that it is difficult for anyone to fathom it all. Every card in the Tarot speaks differently to everyone, but the Priestess seems to bear the widest range of interpretations, because she speaks directly to the Inner Voice, the unconscious mind. She is the manifestation of the unconscious and the effects of the mysterious in our everyday world. Trying to see how such mysteries work often defeats their purpose, and with this in mind, the High Priestess will be explained in as much detail as possible.


She is, above all else, the base of potential that is the source of the power wielded by the Magician. She is the unlimited potential that allows him to transform and create whatever his Will desires. Understanding this type of balance, as found between potential and creation, masculine and feminine, is the key to unlocking some of the mysteries of the High Priestess. We see the clear progression of the theme of balance; instead of integrating opposites, the Priestess keeps them separate and keeps them in balance nonetheles. She herself is the scales; this symbolism is found in many Tarot decks. Without this balance there can be no power.


The second symbolic motif found in almost all instances of the High Preistess are symbols of the unconscious mind. On the Rider-Waite version this motif is especially prominent, but most decks feature at least some lunar imagery that in turn has ties to the unconscious. Most decks that have the "twin pillars" symbology also depict a veil strung between those pillars; the High Priestess stands between us and that veil as a moderator. Behind the veil lies the powers of the unconscious, which we cannot start to understand but which, through her, we can learn to control. She is the gateway to realms that we may never fully comprehend or master.


While it would be impossible for anyone to learn all of her mysteries and secrets, the High Priestess remains as a guide to those of us willing to venture deep within our minds to discover the true powers hidden deep inside each of us. This is the same power as that depicted on the Magician, but the scope of the Priestess' power is far different. While the Magician focuses his powers outward, to achieve a meaningful effect on the world, the High Priestess shows us that we can also use these powers on an inner level, to enrich and transform ourselves. Such transformations are certainly not as dramatic as the Magician's, but they are almost always more powerful.


The High Priestess represents the mysteries of the unconscious and the Inner Voice, and her appearance is often a sign that your own intuition is trying to send you a message. The unconscious often speaks to us in symbols, so be alert around you for anything that seems out of the ordinary. This said, if you have an important decision to make when the Priestess appears, this is often a sign that the answers will be revealed to you, if you are patient and open to the whispers from within. You simply have to wait and be receptive to inner messages. Her lesson is that everything you need to know already exists within you.


The theme of dualism in the High Preistess cannot be avoided either. She is often a sign of the Shadow, the negative portion of your personality that no one sees, and that you yourself could be unaware of. (In this sense, the term 'negative' does not refer to evil, just the opposite polarity from the positive and expressive part of your personality.) If you accept the Shadow within you, its powers will be open to you if you wish to use them. In most people the Shadow side is the more passive of the two, and the Priestess can therefore advocate a need for passivity in a situation. It is not always necessary to act; sometimes goals can be realized through inaction.

Take Which Tarot Card Represents Your Higher Self? Test at HelloQuizzy

Before todays annual milestone ~.~ I wanted to achieve one of my own choosing.  A few weeks back  prodded me into swimming regularly (pretty much every Friday.)  The original deal was whoever 'won' the most would treat the other to dinner at Outback at the end of the year.  She pretty consistently beat me by a couple of lanes, the long lean body goes through water faster than this one that floats but has bulk/resistance.  2 weeks ago she ended up working late and I got a 20+ lane head start, but stayed on to swim with her and made it to 55 lanes (making up for all the extra lanes she had gotten in the prior 6 or so weeks)  before I ran out of time.  That's when I realized I COULD make it to 64 lanes (that is 32 laps) and that is ONE MILE! 

So yesterday I hit the pool at 6pm (yes, the local one is open late on Fridays,  It may not have a slide, or a diving board, but it is not at all crowded!) and swam, and swam, and swam.  It took me almost 90 minutes, but I SWAM A FULL MILE!   So while I may swim like a turtle (I keep my head out of the water so I can see, and so I am very slow, but I'm STEADY!) I got it done!
That will make tonights celebration dinner in honor of the other milestone just a little bit sweeter and (the fact I plan to partake of a peach bellini - to get it checked off on my omnivore 100 list) just a little less guilty to.

While I dont plan to do a full mile every week, I do plan to keep on swimming.  Im a water-tiger for a reason :-)

THANKS to everyone who said they would have accompanied me to see the show, and a huge hug to my Sis who went with me.  We laughed so hard, my ribs are still hurting.  The tix were worth it, we had a surprisingly good view of the stage, close enough to see both the puppets and the actors clearly.  And it was amazing how well the animate and inanimate worked as a team.  
The tunes got into my head and are still there.  I SO NEED that soundtrack!

The incredibly amusing show was followed by wonderful sushi and some serious talking.  Had this conversation taken place 2+ years ago it would have made so many things so much easier, but I didnt realize it (and I think she didnt either.)  Im so glad we talked!

Oh, and the two words: Puppet Shex (yes misspelled on purpose, remove the h to get the real thing.)  And OMG, what a great job of implying the real thing!  For objects created from foam and fabric, that have only an upper body, they left no doubt about just what they were doing.  My brain will never be the same!

I cant help it.  After last nights practice I should be excited and happy (I reached a goal that while I didnt really realize it was a goal, the fact that I am totally psyched happy about it now that I reached it made me realize it was a goal...), but instead Im on the verge of tears I am so frustrated and disappointed.  You see, I have been wanting to see Avenue Q for ages, years really.  When I found out last year that it was coming to town I was THRILLED! I spoke to others who also wanted to see it and agreed (I thought) that we would see it for my birthday this year.  Now one of the group is off in foreign parts at this point, and another is totally pre-occupied, but I thought there were still 2 of us with active interest.  As the date approached she asked when I wanted to go and I suggested Sunday Matinees would be easiest on everyones schedules.  Time passed, opening night came and went, still not a word.  Now I dont like to get pushy about birthday presents, so I was patient.  Apparently too patient. 

At practice last night I asked when we were going to see it and she, with a huge (and in the circumstances VERY TACKY) grin replied, she would love to see it AGAIN (meaning she had already gone with her current boy-toy.)  Im proud of my self for not bursting into tears right then and pointed out that the show was ending Sunday night, and she looked stunned (I will assume it was real obliviousness, not sham) and muttered that her parents were coming into town tomorrow (today) and she had no time between then  and Sunday.
So this morning I went online to try for tickets... The only thing still available is $90 per seat (cheap seats were starting at $25 per... but of course are LONG SOLD OUT)  

I cant find anyone willing to go with, seeing a show, especially one like that, solo is really sad, missing it will be really really frustrating, but I dont know  that I can put out that much cash either.  Guess I will go home and just cry. 

HUGS, sometimes old friends are still the best!  Found one person willing to shell out that kind of cash so have a partner in crime to come with while I hopefully laugh myself sick.  Im still disappointed and hurt, but I wont have many years of regrets to deal with (well, assuming the show is worth $180...)

Meme gakked from  . Not sure I buy it, but it beats some of the other options.

Your result for Reincarnation Placement Exam...

Spy

62% Intrigue, 54% Civilization, 76% Humanity, 37% Urbanization.

Live well, ride fast, and die young, baby!

Well, you turned out to be

something of a rogue. This may not be exactly the life you wanted... but it's difficult to place people who want to enjoy all the romance and intrigue of civilization, without actually having a demanding job. Besides, since you enjoy the benefits of humanity so much more than you enjoy the press of humanity itself... you shouldn't have much trouble with your role in life. As long as you aren't afraid of danger there's a place for you in society, even if it's a rather dark and wicked place. Your mission, if you choose to accept it, is to fulfill the role of a spy.

The good news: You're free and clever, and you can do whatever the heck you want. The bad news: everybody else is free and clever too, and they're not all on your side.

With the flick of a blade, you can change the course of history. Might be fun. Might be a little messy.
